publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1744 Tommy Sheridan: Strip Searching of Four Women Arrested at Faslane—That the Parliament expresses its deep concern that four of the 200 women arrested during the peaceful anti-nuclear weapons protest at Faslane on 12 February 2001 were subjected to strip searches; agrees with the Irish MP John McGuiness that the treatment of these women was "scandalous"; demands a full inquiry into this situation; further expresses its sincere apologies to the four women who were subjected to these searches and resolves to communicate an apology to each of them with a promise of appropriate action in relation to those who ordered these humiliating and degrading strip searches.
S1M-1744 Strip Searching of Four Women Arrested at Faslane (lodged on 12 March 2001) Dorothy-Grace Elder*
S1M-1744 Strip Searching of Four Women Arrested at Faslane (lodged on 12 March 2001) Mr Gil Paterson*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Mr Lloyd Quinan*, Fiona Hyslop*

S1M-1744 Tommy Sheridan: Strip Searching of Four Women Arrested at Faslane—That the Parliament expresses its deep concern that four of the 200 women arrested during the peaceful anti-nuclear weapons protest at Faslane on 12 February 2001 were subjected to strip searches; agrees with the Irish MP John McGuiness that the treatment of these women was "scandalous"; demands a full inquiry into this situation; further expresses its sincere apologies to the four women who were subjected to these searches and resolves to communicate an apology to each of them with a promise of appropriate action in relation to those who ordered these humiliating and degrading strip searches. Supported by: Dorothy-Grace Elder, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Fiona Hyslop
S1M-1744 Strip Searching of Four Women Arrested at Faslane (lodged on 12 March 2001) Kay Ullrich*, Linda Fabiani*
S1M-1744 Strip Searching of Four Women Arrested at Faslane (lodged on 12 March 2001) Michael Russell*, Andrew Wilson*

S1M-1744 Tommy Sheridan: Strip Searching of Four Women Arrested at Faslane—That the Parliament expresses its deep concern that four of the 200 women arrested during the peaceful anti-nuclear weapons protest at Faslane on 12 February 2001 were subjected to strip searches; agrees with the Irish MP John McGuiness that the treatment of these women was "scandalous"; demands a full inquiry into this situation; further expresses its sincere apologies to the four women who were subjected to these searches and resolves to communicate an apology to each of them with a promise of appropriate action in relation to those who ordered these humiliating and degrading strip searches. Supported by: Dorothy-Grace Elder, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Fiona Hyslop, Kay Ullrich, Linda Fabiani, Michael Russell, Andrew Wilson, Fiona McLeod*
S1M-1744 Strip Searching of Four Women Arrested at Faslane (lodged on 12 March 2001) Ms Margo MacDonald*, Shona Robison*
S1M-1744 Strip Searching of Four Women Arrested at Faslane (lodged on 12 March 2001) Tricia Marwick*

Supported by: Dorothy-Grace Elder, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Fiona Hyslop, Kay Ullrich, Linda Fabiani, Michael Russell, Andrew Wilson, Fiona McLeod, Ms Margo MacDonald, Shona Robison, Tricia Marwick, Ms Sandra White

S1M-1744 Tommy Sheridan: Strip Searching of Four Women Arrested at Faslane—That the Parliament expresses its deep concern that four of the 200 women arrested during the peaceful anti-nuclear weapons protest at Faslane on 12 February 2001 were subjected to strip searches; agrees with the Irish MP John McGuiness that the treatment of these women was "scandalous"; demands a full inquiry into this situation; further expresses its sincere apologies to the four women who were subjected to these searches and resolves to communicate an apology to each of them with a promise of appropriate action in relation to those who ordered these humiliating and degrading strip searches.
